question: Can I afford a mortgage of $300,000 with a monthly income of $5,000 and no existing debts?
true_answer: Yes, with monthly income of $5,000 and no debts, you can afford a $300,000 mortgage. Down payment typically 3-20%.

steps.content: Can I afford a mortgage of $300,000 with a monthly income of $5,000 and no existing debts?
Plan: 1) Hand off to home_loan_agent for affordability analysis. 2) Use calculator for monthly payment. 3) Retrieve knowledge on mortgage terms. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Return answer.
Retrieving knowledge on mortgage affordability criteria.
Affordability typically requires DTI below 43% and a stable income.
Calculating the monthly payment for a $300,000 mortgage.
With a monthly income of $5,000, DTI would be 28%, well below 43%.
Does this include other costs like taxes and insurance?
Retrieving information on additional costs associated with mortgages.
Additional costs can include property taxes, insurance, totaling around 1-2% of home value annually.
Retrieving knowledge on down payment requirements.
Down payment is typically 3-20% depending on loan type.
Yes, with monthly income of $5,000 and no debts, you can afford a $300,000 mortgage. Down payment typically 3-20%.
